com.pranavpandey.android.dynamic.utils

Class DynamicLinkUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pranavpandey.android.dynamic.utils.DynamicLinkUtils

  • public class DynamicLinkUtils
extends Object
    A collection of functions to perform various operations on the URL or to generate intents.

    • Method Detail

      • shareApp

        public static void shareApp(@NonNull
                            Context context,
                            @Nullable
                            String title,
                            @Nullable
                            String message)
        Share application via system default share intent so that user can select from the available apps if more than one apps are available.

        This method throws ActivityNotFoundException if there was no Activity found to run the given Intent.

        Parameters:
        context - The context to retrieve the resources. Usually your Application or Activity object.
        title - Application chooser title if more than one apps are available.
        message - Default share message which user can modify. null to supply app and package name.
        Throws:
        ActivityNotFoundException - If no activity is found.
        See Also:
        Intent.ACTION_SEND

      • shareApp

        public static void shareApp(@NonNull
                            Context context)
        Share application via system default share intent so that user can select from the available apps if more than one apps are available.

        This method throws ActivityNotFoundException if there was no Activity found to run the given Intent.

        Parameters:
        context - The context to retrieve the resources. Usually your Application or Activity object.
        Throws:
        ActivityNotFoundException - If no activity is found.
        See Also:
        shareApp(Context, String, String)

      • viewInGooglePlay

        public static void viewInGooglePlay(@NonNull
                                    Context context,
                                    @NonNull
                                    String packageName)
        View app in the Play Store or Android Market.
        Parameters:
        context - The context to retrieve the resources. Usually your Application or Activity object.
        packageName - Application package name to build the search query.
        Throws:
        ActivityNotFoundException - If no activity is found.
        See Also:
        Intent.ACTION_VIEW

      • rateApp

        public static void rateApp(@NonNull
                           Context context)
        View app in the Play Store or Android Market. Can be used for the quick feedback or rating from the user.

        This method throws ActivityNotFoundException if there was no Activity found to run the given Intent.

        Parameters:
        context - The context to retrieve the resources. Usually your Application or Activity object.
        Throws:
        ActivityNotFoundException - If no activity is found.
        See Also:
        viewInGooglePlay(Context, String)

      • moreApps

        public static void moreApps(@NonNull
                            Context context,
                            @NonNull
                            String publisher)
        View other apps of a Publisher in the Play Store or Android Market.

        This method throws ActivityNotFoundException if there was no Activity found to run the given Intent.

        Parameters:
        context - The context to retrieve the resources. Usually your Application or Activity object.
        publisher - Publisher name to build the search query.
        Throws:
        ActivityNotFoundException - If no activity is found.
        See Also:
        Intent.ACTION_VIEW

      • viewUrl

        public static void viewUrl(@NonNull
                           Context context,
                           @NonNull
                           String url)
        View any URL in the available app or browser. Some URLs will automatically open in their respective apps if installed on the the device. Special treatment is applied for the Facebook URLs to open them directly in the app.

        This method throws ActivityNotFoundException if there was no Activity found to run the given Intent.

        Parameters:
        context - The context to retrieve the resources. Usually your Application or Activity object.
        url - Web or app link to open.
        Throws:
        ActivityNotFoundException - If no activity is found.
        See Also:
        Intent.ACTION_VIEW, URL_FACEBOOK_APP

      • report

        public static void report(@NonNull
                          Context context,
                          @Nullable
                          String appName,
                          @NonNull
                          String email)
        Ask questions or submit bug report to the developer via email. Subject of the email will be generated automatically by detecting the manufacturer, device, Android version and the app version along with the supplied app name.

        This method throws ActivityNotFoundException if there was no Activity found to run the given Intent.

        Parameters:
        context - The context to retrieve the resources. Usually your Application or Activity object.
        appName - App name in the email subject. null to get it from the supplied context.
        email - Email id of the developer.
        Throws:
        ActivityNotFoundException - If no activity is found.
        See Also:
        Intent.ACTION_SENDTO, MAIL_TO
